title: Earthing
fullText:
The neutral of the stand-alone power system shall be earthed at the main switchboard. The installation of the earth shall comply with the requirements of AS/NZS 3000. Figure 4.5 illustrates three different types of connections:
(a) Final sub-circuit that is earthed via an earth conductor connected to the earth bar at the main switchboard.
(b) Sub-main connected to a distribution board that is earthed via an earth conductor connected to the earth bar at the main switchboard.
(c) Sub-main having only active(s) and PEN conductor connected to an MEN switchboard that has its own MEN link and earth electrode to the outbuilding requirements of AS/NZS 3000.
NOTES:
1 The sizing of the consumers mains, sub-mains and final sub-circuits, where present, should take into account the allowable voltage drop for an installation as specified in AS/NZS 3000. Detailed design requirements are not specified in this document.
2 Other configurations for supplying multiple buildings are possible using the provisions related to sub-mains in AS/NZS 3000.
